DataElement.preferredName: Agent Food and Drug Administration Approval Delay Skeletal System Adverse Event Administered Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was administration of an agent, an active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect, approved by the Food and Drug Administration,  one of the agencies of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services that assures the safety of foods and cosmetics, and the safety and efficacy of pharmaceuticals, biological products, radiation emitting products, medical devices, and also, animal feed and drugs, to delay adverse events, any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite), of the skeletal system, the framework that supports the soft tissues of vertebrate animals and protects many of their internal organs.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Agent Food and Drug Administration Approval Delay Skeletal System Adverse Event Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of an agent, an active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect, approved by the Food and Drug Administration,  one of the agencies of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services that assures the safety of foods and cosmetics, and the safety and efficacy of pharmaceuticals, biological products, radiation emitting products, medical devices, and also, animal feed and drugs, to delay adverse events, any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite), of the skeletal system, the framework that supports the soft tissues of vertebrate animals and protects many of their internal organs.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Property.preferredName: Food and Drug Administration Approval Delay Skeletal System Adverse Event Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: One of the agencies of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. It assures the safety of foods and cosmetics, and the safety and efficacy of pharmaceuticals, biological products, radiation emitting products, medical devices, and also, animal feed and drugs.:Approved; established by authority; given authoritative approval.:Delay; time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time.:The framework that supports the soft tissues of vertebrate animals and protects many of their internal organs.  The skeletons of vertebrates are made of bone and/or cartilage.:Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.:Given.

Concepts.definition: One of the agencies of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. It assures the safety of foods and cosmetics, and the safety and efficacy of pharmaceuticals, biological products, radiation emitting products, medical devices, and also, animal feed and drugs.
Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.
Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.

The collection of bones and tissues, including ligaments and cartilage, that compose the rigid internal framework of the human body, and which serves a multitude of functions, including structural support, movement, protection, production of blood cells, storage of ions, and endocrine regulation.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
